name: Annapurna Base Camp
summary: The Closest You Can Go To Mt Annapurna Without Climbing It
description: The Annapurna base camp trek is one of the most popular treks in the world. It literally brings you face to face with an eight-thousander – for a moderate-difficult trek, this is incredible! The fascinating Annapurna massif includes the world’s tenth highest peak. Annapurna I (8,091 m) holds an almost fatal attraction for mountaineers. It has the highest fatality ratio among the eight-thousanders. This formidable aura apart, the ABC trek holds several treasures for the mountain lover.

name: Ghorepani Ghandruk Trek
summary: Trek in the foothills of Annapurna to enjoy the pristine nature and simple Nepali life
description: Ghandruk Ghorepani trekking is in Annapurna region, which is north-central part of Nepal. Ghorepani and Ghandruk are the two separate villages. Ghorepani is famous for rhododendron forest as well as the fantastic panoramic sunrise, sunset view from Pun Hill 3210 meters which is one hour climbing from Ghorepani. Ghandruk is a popular tourist place for trekkers in Annapurna area of Nepal, with easy trails and various accommodation possibilities, Gurung culture, Monastery, best views of the Annapurna Mountains including a beautiful massif view of Machhapuchhare, called 'fishtail' from Ghandruk.

name: Khopra Danda Trek
summary: The lesser-known trail that features stunning views of snowcapped mountains and an exposure to various ethnicities of the region
description: Khopra trek is suitable for every dedicated trekker as the most regions of this trail are more strenuous and experiences are profoundly lavish thick pine, oak, rhododendron and bamboo woods. Mohair- Khopra trekking has the views of beautiful vistas, crossing delightful ethnic people of Magar, Poon, Gurung, Kami, Damai, Chetri and Brahmin villages boasting its flawlessly terraced cultivating territories.

name: Tilicho Pass Trek
summary: Journey through Nepal, experience the scenic and challenging trek to one of the highest lakes in the world
description: Tilicho is the beautiful Mountain peak which is in Annapurna region north-central part of Nepal. Tilicho Peak is 7134 meters high above sea level. Tilicho pass trek is famous for trekking with beautiful Lake which is the highest point lake in the world at an altitude 4920 meters high. Tilicho pass trekking is also known as Mesu kanto la pass 5340 meters trekking which offer beautiful Himalayan views of Mount Manaslu 8163m, Mount Dhaulagiri 8167m, Mount Annapurna I. 8091m & others snowy capped mountains of Annapurna region.

name: Nar Phu Valley Trek
summary: The hidden gem that offers trekkers a rare opportunity to explore unspoiled valleys, Himalayan nature and ancient Buddhist culture
description: Nar Fu (Naar Phu) trekking is in the Valley of the Naar Khola in Annapurna region Manang district of Nepal. The route leads us as Annapurna circuit trekking till to Koto then follow Naar Khola valley. Nar-Fu Valley trekking is one of classical trekking in Nepal. According to Nepal government trekking rules to do trekking in Nar or Phu village need special trekking permit. It was recognized very lately. This trekking path leading from the valley into Tibet had never made them dependent on the salt trade, and till today yak herding is the basis of their livelihood.

name: Annapurna Circuit Trek
summary: Challenge yourself to trek the mighty Annapurna Circuit in Nepal.
description: Annapurna circuit is in north-central Nepal that includes two peaks over 8,000 meters, thirteen peaks over 7,000 meters, and sixteen more above 6,000 meters mountains The Annapurna circuit is a well-known trekking. The Annapurna circuit known as Annapurna round or Thorong la pass trekking. Annapurna Circuit, circles the Annapurna Himal itself and includes Nilgiri and Fishtail.Annapurna circuit trek reaches an altitude of 5,416 meters top of Thorong La pass, touching the edge of the fabled Tibetan plateau, Annapurna magnificent mountain scenery. Every year, more than 75,000 tourists do the Annapurna circuit Thorong La pass trekking.
